history.content:
I would recommend splitting 126 and 127 to be able to better absorb everything, as both are hard classes (and 126 a lot of work from what I've heard). You could also just take 1 of them (in which case I think your best option would be to take 126) before 189 or take 189 later. Also, just wondering, why do you want to take 189 in fall of junior year?

-----

Why do you want to take Physics 7B in Spring 2019? 126 and 127 on its own seems more reasonable. 126 and 127 are really hard and you will have to self-study a lot.

I would recommend splitting 126 and 127 to be able to better absorb everything, as both are hard classes (and 126 a lot of work from what I've heard). You could also just take 1 of them (in which case I think your best option would be to take 126) before 189 or take 189 later. Also, just wondering, why do you want to take 189 in fall of junior year?

children.subject: I would say if you really need to take it in fall of junior year, take 126 and 53 before 189 and just take 189 that semester. My guess is that you already took ee16ab so with that + 53 in theory you should not be lost on 127 material and should be able to self-study material as needed to get the most out of 189. I would recommend looking up Sahai's advice on this, he has talked about this before and his advice will be more relevant than mine bc I have not taken 126, 127 or 189 (although if I am not wrong, what I told you goes along the line with his advice)
I've already taken 16A and B as well as 53 so I can substitute 53 for a different class. This advice sounds solid though, thank you again.

If you feel good on proofs and math I would recommend math 110. Not directly helps you for 189, but you will never fret at anything related to linear algebra ever again and will probably be able to grasp linear algebra concepts more easily once you take 189
have you taken 110? you think it’s quite helpful?

Hi Rafael, (this is OP), the way my current (tentative) 4 year plan for courses is set up, it seems to make sense for me to take 189 sooner rather than later. One main motivator for this is that I fear taking 189 later in my undergrad career would make me miss some opportunities in internships and research. This could also be a naive observation. Thank you for your quick response!

Also Rafael mentions that taking 126 and 127 separately would allow me to digest the classes better but, from what you're suggesting, removing 7B (implying adding a breadth or a light weight class to meet units) would accomplish the same thing?
I think generally people delay 7B; it's not useful for EE upperdivs from what I've heard. If you just delayed 7B and added a breadth you could probably manage 126/127/breadth.

(OP responding to the student answer by Ashwinee), I'm anticipating on taking 7B that Spring so I can get the requirement out of the way since I also have to do a natural science elective (I heard 7B also helps with some upper division EE courses from what I've read).

history.content: Would taking EE126, EE127, and Physics 7B be a reasonable schedule for Spring 2019? I want to have 126 and 127 under my belt before I take 189, at the latest the fall of my junior year (I am an incoming sophomore). Would I be able to add another class (such as a H/SS) or would that be a bad idea? Thank you!
history.subject: EE126, EE127, Physics 7B
